channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The documents TikTok wanted to keep secret. And, the concerns with SpaceX's rocket
item.description: NPR has reviewed the documents TikTok didn’t want you to see regarding children's safety. Here's what we found. And, the environmental concerns behind Elon Musk’s rocket Starship.
item.content:encoded:
NPR has reviewed the documents TikTok didn’t want you to see regarding children's safety. Here's what we found. And, the environmental concerns behind Elon Musk’s rocket Starship.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Beyond books: How a public library in Ohio's Rust Belt is spurring economic growth
item.description: The public library in Toledo, Ohio, is one of a number across the U.S. that have become entrepreneurial hubs. Business-specialist librarians are helping aspiring small-business owners and nonprofits for free.
item.content:encoded:
The public library in Toledo, Ohio, is one of a number across the U.S. that have become entrepreneurial hubs. Business-specialist librarians are helping aspiring small-business owners and nonprofits for free.

(Image credit: Nic Antaya for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Award-winning Ukrainian journalist dies in Russian captivity, Kyiv says
item.description: Ukrainian officials on Thursday confirmed the death of freelance journalist Victoria Roshchyna, though the circumstances surrounding her death were unclear.
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainian officials on Thursday confirmed the death of freelance journalist Victoria Roshchyna, though the circumstances surrounding her death were unclear.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Florida airports, amusement parks reopen as officials weigh damage from Hurricane Milton
item.description: Theme parks and the airport in Orlando announced reopenings Friday, but officials warned more flooding could continue in the region over the coming days.
item.content:encoded:
Theme parks and the airport in Orlando announced reopenings Friday, but officials warned more flooding could continue in the region over the coming days.

(Image credit: Giorgio Viera)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: States probed TikTok for years. Here are the documents the app tried to keep secret
item.description: In communications newly revealed, TikTok executives discuss being aware of the harms caused by their app. TikTok officials were warned of the app’s dangers to minors.
item.content:encoded:
In communications newly revealed, TikTok executives discuss being aware of the harms caused by their app. TikTok officials were warned of the app’s dangers to minors.

(Image credit: Sebastien Bozon)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: A teacher recalls when his students schooled the Pentagon
item.description: John Hunter, the teacher in Charlottesville, Va., who invented the World Peace Game, talks about a memorable trip his fourth graders took to the Pentagon.
item.content:encoded: John Hunter, the teacher in Charlottesville, Va., who invented the World Peace Game, talks about a memorable trip his fourth graders took to the Pentagon.
item.dc:creator: Jud Esty-Kendall

item.title: Manufacturers and feds work to stabilize supply of IV fluids for hospitals
item.description: After Hurricane Helene flooded an IV fluid factory in North Carolina, the government and industry are trying to mitigate shortages.
item.content:encoded:
After Hurricane Helene flooded an IV fluid factory in North Carolina, the government and industry are trying to mitigate shortages.

(Image credit: Jae C. Hong)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Worst U.S. whooping cough outbreak in a decade has infected thousands
item.description: America is experiencing its worst whooping cough outbreak in a decade. Experts say there's a cyclical nature to outbreaks like this but that the timing was altered by the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.content:encoded:
America is experiencing its worst whooping cough outbreak in a decade. Experts say there's a cyclical nature to outbreaks like this but that the timing was altered by the COVID-19 pandemic.

(Image credit: imagebroker)
item.dc:creator: Eilis O'Neill

item.title: How we know voter fraud is very rare in U.S. elections
item.description: “Research has been consistent over time that voter fraud is infinitesimally rare,” one expert tells NPR.
item.content:encoded:
“Research has been consistent over time that voter fraud is infinitesimally rare,” one expert tells NPR.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: Her last memory is by the window with her baby in Gaza. Then, Israeli airstrikes hit
item.description: Israel’s military dropped tens of thousands of bombs on Gaza in a year. This is a look at one airstrike, the lives it upended and the rights group's investigation saying it's a possible war crime.
item.content:encoded:
Israel’s military dropped tens of thousands of bombs on Gaza in a year. This is a look at one airstrike, the lives it upended and the rights group's investigation saying it's a possible war crime.

(Image credit: Mohammed Dahman)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy
